purpleculture_pinyin:
miǎo
(of an expanse of water) vast; distant and indistinct; tiny or insignificant
(водного пространства) обширный; далекий и нечеткий; крошечный или незначительный
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 眇 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
渺茫 [ miǎo máng ]: uncertain; remote; distant and indistinct; vague
渺小 [ miǎo xiǎo ]: minute; tiny; negligible; insignificant
浩渺 [ hào miǎo ]: vast; extending into the distance
渺无人烟 [ miǎo wú rén yān ]: remote and uninhabited (idiom); deserted; God-forsaken
渺远 [ miǎo yuǎn ]: distantly remote; also written 邈远
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 眇 [ miǎo ] blind in one eye; subtle, minute, minuscule
heisig_chinese_memo: Insignificant eye problems like a bit of irritation can be fixed with a few drops of water and a towel.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Insignificant eye problems like a bit of irritation can be fixed with a few drops of water and a towel.
humanum_full_description_en:
from " water ", " subtle " sound. " Miao " is the same as " Miao ". The original meaning of " miao " is big water, which means that the water is vast. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Miao, Da Shui Ye. From Sanshui. Or Zuo Miao." "Jade Chapter. Ministry of Water: "Miao, water is long." Such as "Selected Works. "Mu Xuanxu "Hai Fu"": "Hanging, dazzling, indistinct." Li Shan's note: "The invisible, vast and distant." Tang Dynasty Wang Changling's "Yue Nu": "The water on the lake is indistinct and the river is clear." Don't involve."

" Miao " means vast and far-reaching. Such as "Pipe. "Internal Industry": "Foldings are as if they are on the side, suddenly as if they will not, and as insignificant as infinite." Bei Zhou Yuxin, "Zhou Zhuguo General He Ganhong Shentou Stele": "Miaomiao mountains and rivers, 茕茕茕胤子."

" Miao " means vague and unclear. For example, Bai Juyi's "Song of Everlasting Sorrow" in the Tang Dynasty: "Affectionately appreciate the king, one person has two faint voices." Qing Dynasty Gong Zizhen's "Magnolia Slow": "Ask what is happening in the sky, the most ethereal and the most sinking."

" Miao " is also the same as " sing ", which means tiny. For example, in the Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi's "Pre-Chibi Fu": "Send a mayfly to the world, a millet in the sea." Liu Xianting of the Qing Dynasty "Guangyang Miscellaneous. Volume Two: "In the universe, everything is beautiful, and human beings are small and unable to express their accumulation."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " water ", " subtle " sound. The original meaning is big water, that is, the vastness of water.
humanum_full_description:
從「水」，「眇」聲。「渺」同「淼」，本義是大水，即水多遼闊之貌。《說文新附》：「淼，大水也。从三水。或作渺。」《玉篇．水部》：「渺，水長也。」如《文選．木玄虛〈海賦〉》：「浺瀜沆瀁，渺瀰湠漫。」李善注：「渺瀰湠漫，曠遠之貌。」唐代王昌齡〈越女〉：「湖上水渺漫，清江不可涉。」

　　「渺」引申表示遼闊、廣遠。如《管子．內業》：「折折乎如在於側，忽忽乎如將不得，渺渺乎如窮無極。」北周庾信〈周柱國大將軍紇干弘神道碑〉：「渺渺山河，煢煢胤子。」

　　「渺」表示模糊不清、無法把握。如唐代白居易〈長恨歌〉：「含情凝睇謝君王，一別音容兩渺茫。」清代龔自珍〈木蘭花慢〉：「問人天何事，最飄渺，最銷沉。」

　　「渺」亦同「眇」，表示微小。如北宋蘇軾〈前赤壁賦〉：「寄蜉游於天地，渺滄海之一粟。」清代劉獻廷《廣陽雜記．卷二》：「宇宙之中，萬美畢具，人靈渺小，不能發其蘊。」
humanum_short_description: 從「水」，「眇」聲。本義是大水，即水多遼闊之貌。

渺字的基本解释

渺
miǎo
微小：渺小。渺不足道。
水势辽远：浩渺。渺邈。渺渺。渺然。
茫茫然，看不清楚：渺茫。渺无人迹。

渺字的汉语字典释义

[①]［miǎo］
［《廣韻》亡沼切，上小，明。］
(1)水远貌。参见“渺瀰”。
(2)邈远；渺茫。
(3)微小；藐小。
(4)量词。表示重量的小单位。

渺字的英文翻译

◎ 渺
insignificant, tiny, vague, vast

渺字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　渺； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页635第17
【廣韻】亡沼切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】弭沼切，?音眇。渺㵿，水貌。一曰水長也。【管子·內業篇】渺渺乎，如窮無極。

渺字的源字形

渺字的起名意思

：辽阔，浩渺，渺莽（烟波辽阔无际的样子）。

miǎo
I прил.
1) необъятный (о водном просторе), безбрежный, широкий (о водном пространстве)
渺无涯际 так широк, что кажется не имеет пределов
2) удаленный; неясный; неразличимый; туманный
渺不知 из-за отдалённости не разобрать
3) маленький; ничтожный; крохотный
渺无希望 нет ни малейшей надежды
